artist: Designer: Utagawa Hiroshige II; Publisher: Commissioned by Sagamiya Tōkichi
description: carved on both sides; one side carved with figures walking on a garden path; other side carved with standing man in a kimono with tree and bridge pattern fabric, holding an umbrella; dark brown patina
markings:
URC on side with garden, on sticker: [L54.153 / Hiroshige]; ULC on side with man: darkened sticker
Engraved as the following
Side A: To_to sanju_rokkei  Sakura hana Asuka yama?  dated 1862,6
Side B:Publisher Aito, Carver Hori Tashichi dated 1861, 6
portfolio: From Thirty-six Views of the Eastern Capital (Tōto sanjūrokkei 東都三十六景)
title: Keyblock for "Autumn Flowers in the Garden at Mukōjima"
